website_summaries.verdict: Light duty driving gloves fit well, yet provide the flexibility you need to maneuver your fingers.
pros: Easy to put on, yet also fit snugly, thanks to snap button closure at the wrist
Includes knuckle holes that allow for freedom of movement
Allow you to operate a touch screen device while wearing them
cons: No padding inside the glove, so not made for very cold weather

customer_reviews.title: Dye bleeds when wet!
customer_reviews.text: Bad dye job! Do not get wet! Stained my hands and everything I touched!
customer_reviews.author: Matt K

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality leather
customer_reviews.text: First impression: excellent quality leather. These are thin gloves, the smell like fresh leather, they fit relatively perfectly. I have big hands for my height, but the sizing called for medium. I do not believe they will require a break-in period seeing how they fit. I intend to use these are driving and commuter gloves for 3 out of 4 seasons. I will produce an update in the spring or summer to determine their reliability. Early update: these gloves will work on your smartphone for typing. Also, the leather is very soft. That's a word of caution.
customer_reviews.author: Mariano Torres

customer_reviews.title: NOT the glove I thought it was.
customer_reviews.text: It "looked" like the gloves I used to wear, but they are not. The one's I wore were thinner, like a second skin. The leather gave me better contact with the wheel, but did not diminish the sense of contact with it. These gloves are twice as thick, like winter gloves. Driving with these gloves is like making love with a cheap condom.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth H. Sayers

customer_reviews.title: Nice gloves with a fair price point.
customer_reviews.text: Sizing chart is accurate. My hand has a 9" circumference and the large fits perfectly. Glove has a snug fit - leather is soft and will give over time. Some reviewers noted that the gloves are thin. These gloves seem to be what I would call a normal thickness..keeping in mind that they are designed more for function than warmth. I paid $28 on Amazon and it seems to be a good price point for these gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Shopper100

customer_reviews.title: I recommend the gloves
customer_reviews.text: So I drive professionally a cdl vehicle and use these gloves all the time and I love them they have good grip as well as you feel things pretty well especially because I’m not used to gloves the only issue I have with them is that they stain your hands every time I use them as seen in the picture
customer_reviews.author: Dario Madrigal

customer_reviews.title: Better than many reviews
customer_reviews.text: I don't know why some had problems with the dye rubbing off on their skin unless they were caught in a downpour? Mine fit well, grip the handles of my Vespa and my Triumph & my sportscar as intended. I've been caught in the rain, but not an onslaught. Large fit as they should. They look sharp, like Steve McQ would have worn, and not a spot of dye on my hands. Maybe they fixed the problem? II don't know. All I can say is they are perfect driving ( riding ) gloves, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. D

customer_reviews.title: These should be called Hand Dying Gloves since thats what they do.
customer_reviews.text: I'm very disappointed with these gloves. $25 is a lot of money for me, especially for a pair of leather gloves. I had this in my wishlist for so long. Finally back in March I ordered them. I took a road trip to New Orleans from Memphis, and when I arrived my hands were dyed black. I was so disappointed. I tried them again a little later and the same thing happened.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Deason

customer_reviews.title: Not that great...
customer_reviews.text: To start with, these are very slippery gloves which kind of makes them useless for driving. Also, the left glove is quite a bit larger than the right one. I don't feel like they're made very well either. I wanted to like them but I think that I'm trying a lot harder than the manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Sigel

customer_reviews.title: way over priced...
customer_reviews.text: way over priced ... they fit well, look good , i have gone through 3 pairs and two of the pair lasted six months the third pair only lasted two months, they due stain your hands of black ink for a few days, all three pair ripped as i put them on and all three wore out in the finger tips due to the vent holes at the finger tips , i drive a semi truck for a living these gloves are great in the beginning , they just don't last long , i only used them for driving....
customer_reviews.author: Terry Bigjoe

customer_reviews.title: I think these gloves are very nice to wear
customer_reviews.text: I think these gloves are very nice to wear. I give it a 4 for two reasons: 1) the snap is a little hard to close against my wrist but it may loosen up a bit with time. Pushing it down into my wrist is uncomfortable. Velcro may be better. 2) Not the glove's fault but it doesn't quite have the grip on my steering wheel that I would have preferred. The steering wheel is leather but very smooth so it's more difficult for the glove to grab it. Overall, still glad I bought them and will continue to use.
customer_reviews.author: J J Long

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Sheepskin Leather
customer_reviews.text: I've owned a pair of brown gloves that I purchased over 30 years ago and are still in great condition. But trusting that these would be as nice as as my brown ones, was going to be hard to do. When I received my black pair of the Pratt & Hart gloves, I knew right away these were excellent quality. After I tried them on, I was amazed at how well they fit. If you're looking for an excellent pair of driving gloves, look no further. These are the real deal!
customer_reviews.author: G.T.B

customer_reviews.title: fits as expected
customer_reviews.text: I measured my hand before ordering and the gloves fit well. The knuckle holes line up properly, which is a common miss on this style of glove. Reasonably grippy on my leather steering wheel. The only minor issue I have is that sometimes a seam inside the finger gets in to the wrong spot and causes a little discomfort, and I can't adjust it when I'm driving.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Heironimus

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I have tried quite a few brands of leather driving gloves, and i always underwhelmed or disappointed. These are half the price, and MUCH, much better quality leather, much better fit and sizing, much better snap, every single thing about them is SUPERIOR. Half the price, wayyyy better quality! How often do you see that?! I'm going to buy a couple more pair just to have them! I am very happy to write this review. I will never buy another pair of driving gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Justaguy

customer_reviews.title: Turns your hands black.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had these gloves for 2 days and they make my hands turn black whenever I remove them. I don’t sweat a lot of my hands either. Really disappointed since they are comfortable and look nice but can’t have my hands turning black after every use.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Kent

customer_reviews.title: Now He's Racing Along!
customer_reviews.text: My husband has eczema which makes his hands really sore. We came up with the idea of wearing driving gloves and these ones are perfect. They are not too thick, fit him perfectly and now he can hold the steering wheel comfortably. He also feels a bit like Jackie Stewart even though he's only driving a Honda!!
customer_reviews.author: Marchnata

customer_reviews.title: Feel like a pro
customer_reviews.text: I love the way the gloves feel. It reminds me of the movie Drive and for the price I am happy with the purchase. The only reason I did not give it 5 stars is because since my fingers are long the glove does not fit as fitted as I would prefer. In any case I am still happy with these gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Gabo08

customer_reviews.title: Great elegant thin leather.
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding. I bought the Prat and Hart and the Riparo ones, both full-finger leather driving gloves. Both excellent. I was undecided on which to select, so I bought both. They look almost identical on the web photos, however, the Riparo feel thicker than the Prat and Hart, the Pratt are thinner leather. One is more heafty, the other more elegant. I will use the Riparo for the vintage motorbike, the Pratt and Hart for the auto. :) Very happy with my purchases. Hope this is helpful to others facing the same choice.
customer_reviews.author: Milo

customer_reviews.title: Look good, may dye hands a little bit.
customer_reviews.text: This gloves fit well, and look very nice. However, I have two critiques. The first one is that they are not very friendly to cap active touch screens all of the time, it can be difficult to tap on icon or swipe occasionally. I have found the most reliable method to be using the flat area of the thumb. The second criticism I have is that after a day of driving with them when they arrived, they did leave some dye on my hands - it does wash off fairly easily, and perhaps will not be a problem after much more use.
customer_reviews.author: C. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Strong smell
customer_reviews.text: Gloves are fine, if a bit loose. I've got small hands though so I kind of expected that to be the case. Order a size down and they'd probably fit you fine. What brings it down to four instead of five stars is the very strong smell they have. Ive let them air out for weeks now and its still pretty overpowering and it clings to my hands for hours after I take them off.
customer_reviews.author: Noah

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking gloves that ask for sacrifices
customer_reviews.text: I would say more of 3.5 stars Technically the gloves are really slick look very nice and cool but man the dye is a huge problem and fit is small. I ordered bigger size and wear only in cold times so I don't sweat :) fashion asks for sacrifice sometimes!
customer_reviews.author: Mubister

customer_reviews.title: These Gloves were an Excellent Purchase!
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are fantastic! They fit well and really grip my leather steering wheel making the twisty and turny roads I drive in my MX-5 a pleasure. I ordered the brown after reading other reviews about the black ones bleeding black dye and found no issue with the brown. I may order another pair as a spare. I highly recommend these!
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Cogan

customer_reviews.title: Best Bang for your Buck
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these in a size small and they fit quite well! These are nice quality driving gloves. Real leather. It has the P&H logo and size on the inside of the glove. The gloves are not super slim however, but I assume if you wanted tailored gloves you would have to inquire elsewhere and pay a heftier price. But for the money and functionality, these are great! And they fit. My only critique is that the snap closure is very secure so that it makes it a hassle to open. Definitely do get these- looks great with your leather jacket and your favorite suit! Cheers!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The gloves do feel great though. I have little bitch hands so I ...
customer_reviews.text: I got the brown ones to wear while I operate heavy equipment. After a day of sweaty hands, I took them off to find lots of dye had seeped into my skin. My hands had a purple tint to them. Also, after only a few weeks of use, the stitching is already tearing. The gloves do feel great though. I have little bitch hands so I got size small and they fit nice and snug. At $28, I think theyre a little overpriced. $20 would be a better price.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Andrews

customer_reviews.title: Not durable.
customer_reviews.text: Not durable. I am a professional driver and these gloves will not hold up to daily use. I have had 2 pairs and both began to tear between the fingers after about 2 months. They do feel good. If you want to use them occasionally, they may work for you.
customer_reviews.author: TycoonMD

customer_reviews.title: Good array of sizes, great value
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves this style of gloves but they are hard to find in his size, these fit perfectly. He as so pleased to get them for Christmas. The quality of the leather and stitching is very good .
customer_reviews.author: Beviejane

customer_reviews.title: Amazing driving and all around great leather glove
customer_reviews.text: I have bought 4 different pairs of winter gloves that were thinner but yet would keep my hands warm. These are the best I have yet to find. I would rather have one that doesn't have a snap and just pull on but these work great. I also would like them to have the ability to use my phone. Out side of that. I love the feel and warmth of the glove. Don't let the small holes hold you back from getting them. These are amazing gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Robert D.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome! I was using "search gloves" from another company
customer_reviews.text: Awesome! I was using "search gloves" from another company, not for searching, but for everyday use and driving due to the damage that has been done to my hands over the years.. I went ahead and bought these on a whim, and I am sold, sold sold! Much easier to put on, and much more confortable for everything I do, especially for driving.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice Gloves!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice gloves that have a quality feel to them and fit perfectly. I would say I have average sized hands for a 57 year old male and I selected XL, which is a perfect fit for me. They are nice to keep in the car and use when I want a pair of gloves on but do not want anything bulky. They have a good tactile feel to them also, very nice.
customer_reviews.author: Ken T

customer_reviews.title: Poor grip
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these primary to preserve the leather on my steering wheel but it was a bad combination and felt very slippery with poor grip. Perhaps all leather gloves would prove to provide the same grip and simply purchased the wrong material for my goals... so take my experience with a grain of salt :)
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Chicoine

customer_reviews.title: These are alright...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these driving gloves for two reasons: A) to look like Jason Statham from the Transporter and B) to prevent me from picking my fingernails while driving. I should have listened to the reviews I looked at and purchased the smaller size, as they stretched and are now loose. The biggest problem I had with them was that for the first year that I wore them, they would leave black residue on my fingers. I suppose in hindsight, I should have returned them, but it's too late for that now. These are decent gloves, but they should definitely fix that issue.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: ... through several gloves and I think these are my favorite so far
customer_reviews.text: Been through several gloves and I think these are my favorite so far. Insulated ones limited dexterity. Thin wool ones ended up with holes. These pack light, provide a little protection from cold winds, and I can still use the touch screen on my phone with them on if i press firmly
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Good fit, good quality.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to drive with, and keep my leather steering wheel looking good. So far they have been fantastic. Finally I have a pair of driving gloves which keeps my steering wheel clean, and not too hot in the summer. BTW, they look good too!
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Comfy gloves for anywhere as well as driving
customer_reviews.text: I'll keep ordering these as I wear old ones out. Great fit, great stitching. Takes abuse before holes form (used driving a lot and other activities.) They keep my cold hands warm and even when it is warm out they also do an excellent job of airing out hand so sweat doesn't build and it stays cool. They have good grip for steering wheels or other uses. Have no problem using a touchscreen phone with these either (other than the occasional fat fingering which happens without gloves anyways.)
customer_reviews.author: AmZ user

customer_reviews.title: Perfect! Great Quaility! Very Happy
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these from Amazon via Leatherglovesonline.com and they came in QUICK. The projected date was a WEEK from Today... so it was a nice suprize they are early. Also, the gloves are exactly what you "should" expect. I have medium sized hands and they are perfrect fit. fingers fit to the end of the finger holes and they are snug... just how I hoped them to be. AND they ARE! They feel good, soft, but with a good finish. The stitching and leather looks great. You will not be dissappointed with these gloves. I am looking forward to driving my car today when I leave work Buy them!
customer_reviews.author: B. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable Driving Gloves
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the brown gloves after reading reviews about the black ones having the dye rub off on people's hands. I've had no such problem with these. They're very comfortable and work as intended. Attached video contains the gloves being used while just out for a cruise on the autobahn lol
customer_reviews.author: Barrington

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: Fit is wrong from right hand to left, length of fingers is not the same, one side fits only OK, the other side is too small. I've bought motorcycle gloves for less than these that have much more comfortable and durable leather, these are just cheap.
customer_reviews.author: windsor59

customer_reviews.title: Great pair for beginners
customer_reviews.text: I know little to nothing about gloves. But I love to drive. The winter had been a little rough on my hands and my fingers would get very numb on my steering wheel and shifter. These will not make your fingers all warm and toasty (not their purpose) but they give you mobility and proper ventilation when driving. I also don't have numb fingers in 20 degree weather anymore. As far as grip and control, I really would feel confident during spirited driving. They may be gloves out there that are better, but these are a great value for those that are not familiar with this type of hand-wear.
customer_reviews.author: Unihiron

customer_reviews.title: Great Gloves
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves these gloves, I have ordered 4 pairs for him over the last 3 years. I also ordered a pair for his best friend.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Nice gloves
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had any problems with dye coming off on my hands yet, but I don't sweat in them. They are actually very good for winter driving, even with the holes.
customer_reviews.author: twinscubsclones

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and well made.
customer_reviews.text: As they age I even like them better. Great for good gripping. I like the airholes to keep the hands from getting sweaty. They are holding up well.
customer_reviews.author: Graysailor

customer_reviews.title: These are the ones you need to buy
customer_reviews.text: Extremely well fitted gloves , loved them so much I bought a second pair. This is the pair you need to buy trust me. It has that amazing rich leather smell to them and great price. I tried a different pair before these and they smelled like rotting cow and I had to throw them away because of the smell.
customer_reviews.author: Angel Reyes

customer_reviews.title: Nice Driving Gloves
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are lightweight, comfortable, and handsome. I enjoy putting them on, getting behind the while of the ol' muscle car and getting on the road. They provide an excellent grip and keep any sweat or oil from mucking up my steering wheel. OK, so they may not be a necessity for driving, but they are nice indulgence at a very reasonable price. Important Note: The gloves are true to size. They don't run big or small, so make sure you measure before you order!
customer_reviews.author: Rod

customer_reviews.title: Sizing is inconsistent.
customer_reviews.text: Sizing is weird on these. Either the fingers are the right length and the hand size is way small or the fingers are too long for the palm and wrist to be good. Large is too small for my palm and wrist. XL leaves a solid half inch extra on the fingers and makes the knuckles not line up. Sad :/
customer_reviews.author: DrSteinman

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding
customer_reviews.text: Thanks to the cold weather I needed some really nice grippy driving gloves and I like the ones that Ryan Gosling wore in the movie "Driver". And these are awesome good quality leather the fit is perfect and they make driving more enjoyable, I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: E. Monsanto

customer_reviews.title: Very nice driving gloves!
customer_reviews.text: These are very comfortable driving gloves. They are thin enough to feel everything, but so well made they shouldn't fall apart. This is the second pair of these gloves I have had, and the first ones are still in great condition, only a little dirty, so I decided to get a new pair. The only negative is that they are a little slippery on a leather steering wheel, but that tends to diminish as they age and get oils and dirt into the leather.
customer_reviews.author: dr Phil Gandini

customer_reviews.title: Last about a year(stretch, holes, dehydrate). Keep nailes trimmed and no rings!
customer_reviews.text: My previous pair lasted a year: if you wear rings, DONT! They will wear to holes where rings are. Keep your nails trimmed more, any pressure of nails will and did wear gaping holes in the finger tips. If you do these things, they will last longer, they are not designed for every day use, just driving or, doing a few things. They will become dehydrated in about a year. Also, they will noticeably stretch in about a year, so get 1 size up, or don't get it snug fit, unless you don't mind buying another pair in a year.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality
customer_reviews.text: Fits perfect and the leather quality is quite impressive. I drive a manual transmission and it's a great feel to have the gloves for shifting and steering. Definitely worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: jpseagull

customer_reviews.title: Great for Driving & Dog Walking in Cool Weather
customer_reviews.text: I bought these mainly for when I walk the dog in the cold (50s) and they work great. They also make good driving gloves for the car when the steering wheel is chilly. They fit as expected, are well-made & supple enough to operate my phone with ease. If they have them in brown, I'll get another pair.
customer_reviews.author: Klaatu Barada Nicto

customer_reviews.title: GREAT LEATHER.  RUN LARGE.
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my son. He loves them, but returned for a size smaller than he usually wears. These are driving gloves,and should be snug. Up side is that he got the smaller pair in very short order. Good customer service.
customer_reviews.author: GBM

customer_reviews.title: best driving gloves for their price.
customer_reviews.text: these are my 2nd pair I've bought, it only gets 4 outa 5 because they will wear out, they are very thin gloves so any physical activity with them will wear them down quickly. I use these for costume, i like to cut the fingers off. great for mad max cosplay. they are super comfortable and feel great, very well made. if you strictly use them for driving they will last you well.
customer_reviews.author: John Chandler

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Christmas Gift
customer_reviews.text: My father has a pair of leather driving gloves that he has worn for as long as I can remember... they are falling apart. I bought these as a replacement. They are perfect - he is a large man, and the large fit well. And with leather they will stretch and mold to his hands as he uses them. I got these because they are very similar to his old ones... but also because I believe the holes on knuckles and where it clasps provides a little ventilation... but that is just my theory since my dad is the one who is wearing them.
customer_reviews.author: Alli K

customer_reviews.title: Get your size.
customer_reviews.text: I got a size larger as many were saying to do. I should have just ordered my size as these are a tad bit too big. Throwing all that aside there are quality gloves at a reasonable price. Very comfortable too. I would recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Proudveteran

customer_reviews.title: Phenomenal fall driving gloves
customer_reviews.text: These were DEFINITELY not designed as winter gloves, let me start with that. However, if you bought these expecting them to be winter gloves, you would be missing the point entirely. No, these are a light-protection fall fashion statement that just happen to be excellent for spirited drives through back roads and fast blasts on the highway. As 45 degree and up driving gloves, these are outstanding. I'm not sure how long they'll stay that way, but for now, 3 months in, I love 'em!
customer_reviews.author: willdrumforfood01

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: great gloves. great value. the dye lot I received does NOT fade. I got them soaking wet and dried on a white paper towel. NO dye runoff. measurement directions work great!
customer_reviews.author: Amazonshopperxxxxxxxxxxxx

customer_reviews.title: traditional mens driving gloves
customer_reviews.text: i just received my black leather Richmond Classic Gloves, courtesy of Leather Gloves Online. they got here a few days early, they smell great like leather should, they're thin, no lining, snap close elasticated cuff. i got size Medium-my hands are big but narrow and they are a little small, but the leater will streatch to my hands. Large probably will fit most big handed men quite perfectly. all in all, these are exactly the gloves i wanted, and on a more personal note, being the George Romero fan that i am, upon trying them on, streatched out my hands and said in my best karloff voice, "they're coming to get you, Barbara."
customer_reviews.author: Chin Wa Tsun

customer_reviews.title: My boyfriend loves them!
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my boyfriend and he really enjoys them. The material is soft and they fit his hands well.
customer_reviews.author: Puppy

customer_reviews.title: they are comfortable, fit well
customer_reviews.text: I've had these gloves for about a year and a half, and they're getting to the point where they need to be replaced. Several of the fingertips have large holes. I'm not too surprised, since they are inexpensive, and I didn't take care of them with any leather treater. Otherwise, they are comfortable, fit well, but do stain hands when you sweat in them. I'm about to get a second pair, will take better care of them, and report back on the longevity.
customer_reviews.author: Rudolfs Namikis

customer_reviews.title: beautiful and inexpensive
customer_reviews.text: Wow i was half expecting these to feel cheap because of the inexpensive price tag but i was wrong! The leather on these is thin, flexible, smells great, looks great, and the inside feels extra soft. The shipping was free and the seller got it to my door asap with return information included if the size didnt fit. i'm totally satisfied with this purchase. If you're looking for a pair of classic driving gloves to make you feel like a boss on the road, get these! don't waste your money on the 'authentic' italian ones floating around amazon.
customer_reviews.author: TeeGeeOh

customer_reviews.title: On the tight side
customer_reviews.text: Owned two pairs. The large was too large, but the medium was too tight! But the leather is real and wonderfully soft, so the trick (at least for me) is to buy them tight and work through the pain until they loosen up. The look is great, and I wear them all the time with my motorcycle. Just be warned that a suntan with these glove is ugly indeed!! Given the price and feel, I will most definitely buy replacements if mine ever break or are lost.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Really nice, soft REAL leather
customer_reviews.text: Really nice, soft REAL leather. Fingers are a little long but not enough to be bothersome. Medium size fits me about right. The dye tends to come off on your skin if they get wet from sweat or rain; but will wash off easily enough. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: H. Dinwiddie

customer_reviews.title: Not only to these make you look like an absolute boss but they are also a dream ...
customer_reviews.text: Not only to these make you look like an absolute boss but they are also a dream to drive with. The leather is delightfully soft and supple yet does wonders to enhance the grip and comfort of the wheel. Skipping gears and under steering are things of the past when wearing sweet driving gloves like these and anyone who cuts you off will fear for their lives when they see you in their rear view.
customer_reviews.author: Logan H.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome driving Gloves!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for my husband for Christmas! These are very well made and fit to size! He loved them!
customer_reviews.author: Christine C.

customer_reviews.title: good for the money
customer_reviews.text: The person I purchased them for likes them a lot as shooting gloves. The leather is thin and very soft. It was a Large size and fit well for his hands (actually small hands but glove sizing is riduculous) just follow the chart... The only problem is the wrist fit, which is too high even for small wrists.. Velcro might have been better than snaps. Thus I am deducting one star.
customer_reviews.author: Vivaldi Guy

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: For the price, the gloves are great. Has that great leather smell and molds to your hand fairly quickly. I have not experienced the dyed hands like others but my drive to work(20 minutes) may be much shorter than others. The thumb could be a bit more fitted but other than that these have been good so far.
customer_reviews.author: J-mo751

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable.  Do not order a size up.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice. I almost purchased a large because I was afraid medium would be too small. The medium fits perfect. Almost too large in the sense that they do not need to stretch at all. I am 5' 10" 180 lbs, medium build. As far as comfort, they feel super comfortable. I used them to drive my BMW 135i convertible on a recent sunny afternoon, and they were perfect.
customer_reviews.author: DJW

customer_reviews.title: The right fits great. Great feel
customer_reviews.text: Fits well, finger sleeves on left hand are a little long, but I think that's my own hand's fault. The right fits great. Great feel, good grip on the wheel. Nice quality leather, supple and flexible without feeling flimsy. To say they're great for the price would be a disservice. These are very nice indeed.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary Kezios

customer_reviews.title: Super quality for the price!
customer_reviews.text: True fit, comfortable and great appearance. I only wish I could get more than a year out of each pair but at the current price, I have no objection to buying them.
customer_reviews.author: STLricky

customer_reviews.title: Great fit, affordable, great design driving gloves.
customer_reviews.text: Fits my big hands! These gloves fit like a glove. I have always had difficulty finding driving gloves to fit my large hands. These are perfect. The XXXL was just right and the added bonus of soft leather is fantastic. The price point is also one of the best features. I would definitely highly recommend to anyone .
customer_reviews.author: Bill Shaw

customer_reviews.title: He liked them, they fit well.Nice construction!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as a gift for a middle aged male. The gloves fit well and material looks stylish; the gloves have strongly sewn seams and appear to be made of a good quality leather. Though I likely won't purchase again as they were requested specifically for a gift, I would recommend for a moderately priced, well constructed nice looking driving glove.
customer_reviews.author: Whitney

customer_reviews.title: Driving Gloves
customer_reviews.text: Purchased them at Christmas and my husband has used them several time including a trip across the country where we drove from coast to coast in 24 days visiting friends and family. They are exactly what he was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Gloves that make any car a sports car
customer_reviews.text: Bought these gloves for the purpose of getting more grip for the steering wheel. I have a leather steering wheel and after a while of driving my hands get moist and I loose grip. Unfortunately, these gloves didn't really solve the problem. The construction is very good, stitching and fit is good. However, I wish the designers would have lined the palmar face with some sort of tacky material like what football gloves are made of. That would've made the product 5 star! Other than this, these gloves make the driver look masculine and confident. Turned so many heads while driving down an NYC street and while at stop lights.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Mabida

customer_reviews.title: Awesome driving gloves!
customer_reviews.text: Very good quality. I measured my hands and used the size chart, so they fit, well, you know... I'm not going to say it. I love these. They are snug, comfortable, have great traction and tactile sense, look cool, and feel like they're pretty good quality, not just considering the price, which was very, very reasonable. I'll probably buy a brown pair before long and I'll buy another pair once I've worn these out.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel R.

customer_reviews.title: They are made of a very soft sheep skin which feels great and are flexible enough to pick up a coin ...
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are true to size and if you order correctly they will be a pleasure to wear. They are made of a very soft sheep skin which feels great and are flexible enough to pick up a coin or turn the page of a newspaper or magazine. Another plus is they give you a good grip and feel for the steering wheel and gear shift (5 speed Miata) as you cruise down the highway. The price ($26.95) is reasonable and the quality appears to be excellent. Charles(NAHUM 1:7 / JOHN 3:16 KJV)
customer_reviews.author: Reverend Charles D. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Cool
customer_reviews.text: These are nice. The finger vents keep them cool in most conditions. The snap is a pain sometimes but velcro on gloves like this would be vulgar. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Deneen

customer_reviews.title: These gloves ate pretty nice. I saw the made in China tag ...
customer_reviews.text: These gloves ate pretty nice. I saw the made in China tag and was worried but they seem to be holding up very well. The leather is real, soft and very comfortable. Not too hot but won't let my hands get too cold either. If you get them wet expect a blue/black tint to your skim for a few days though ;)
customer_reviews.author: Mr. TatufaceTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Genuine Leather, these gloves are legitimate!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these gloves for Halloween to cosplay because I thought they were cheap quality but I must say, these gloves are really great. They are 100% genuine leather. They smell great and I am definitely going to use them for driving now.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Good gloves but 'bleeds' on you
customer_reviews.text: Like many of the other posts, these are great gloves, fit well and are soft. However, after wearing them after several hours of driving when I took them off and found my hands were discolored black! This caused some dismay since I was slated to give a lecture in front of a large audience the next day. Now I am not saying I don't sweat profusely. However, it was fall when I worse these gloves so it was not hot outside (nor did I need any AC on). The black did scrub off but it took some effort.
customer_reviews.author: S. Jensen

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Really nice leather and well constructed. Kind of surprised at the price. Expected less quality. Shipped fast and packed well.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Solid purchase.
customer_reviews.text: I am impressed. I've never had driving gloves before but this one seems to make my search final. Great design, classic, soft leather, good color, perfect fit. Some rewiers complain that it's too thin; I like it the way it is - don't need them for keeping my hands warm (it's one of many purposes I got them). Other sellers not shipping free under $35. This one did. Over all, solid purchase. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: AMa

customer_reviews.title: really worth the money and are leather
customer_reviews.text: on my 2nd winter in these and wonder how i made it without them. they fit snugly, lay on dash for easy grab on the go. have no trouble picking up small items. great for keeping germs off hands while shopping but they could have a touch sensitive spot for working an iPhone . a small problem there.
customer_reviews.author: TurnKey23

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves, great value
customer_reviews.text: These gloves exceed my expectations. I was somewhat skeptical because of the reasonable price, but I will call these excellent at any price. I can't see any reason to pay more for driving gloves. They truly deserve the many 5 star ratings they have received and I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: DD

customer_reviews.title: Best Driving Gloves
customer_reviews.text: I received my driving gloves today and they are Exactly like a pair I purchased in the 90's. These are made by Pratt & Hart They make your hands feel stronger and Feel great on the fingers. They fit so well, I can pick up a dime , while wearing them.
customer_reviews.author: jerry Maulden

customer_reviews.title: Convenient, cool and soft !
customer_reviews.text: These are nice, convenient, soft but somewhat slightly slippery to the touch. However, it does the job for now and I am happy since I started wearing gloves for my ride. I don't have a sports car (don't need to) I just like the way it allows me to handle the steering wheel better, especially as it is getting colder out and wearing a hefty winter driving gloves can be quite cumbersome, if you know what I mean.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: My new favorite Motorcyle gloves
customer_reviews.text: Very soft leather. Very comfortable and provided just the right traction on the handlebar grips.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Macaluso

customer_reviews.title: Good gloves, good price
customer_reviews.text: First off, don't believe the glove sizing guide. I ordered gloves based on that and they were too small, they fit my hand perfectly widthwize, but I guess I have fairly long hands in relation to other men with hands as wide as mine are. I've been using them for a while now and they feel good, look good (although a bit wide for my hands but short of a tailor can't do much better to be honest) and works.
customer_reviews.author: Bleep Torpors

customer_reviews.title: No grip!
customer_reviews.text: These were disappointing. Fit is loose, if you wear large, you may want to consider mediums. But the bigger issue is that driving gloves are supposed to give you a secure grip on the wheel. These are actually slippery!
customer_reviews.author: marclouisb

customer_reviews.title: Great pair of gloves
customer_reviews.text: Soft, fine leather. Fit was as expected. Comfortable to wear. "Touch" for screen use could be a little better.
customer_reviews.author: S Spurlock

customer_reviews.title: Delayed review
customer_reviews.text: I waited to review the gloves and good thing. They fit nice and are soft. Nice driving gloves. But they are wearing out on the palms of the glove, and I don't even use them that often. By not often, I estimate I've worn them a dozen or so times. Not a good thing.
customer_reviews.author: misstSubo

customer_reviews.title: they fit
customer_reviews.text: liked them generally except they are slick on the outside so you don't get the type of grip you would expect from good driving gloves.
customer_reviews.author: J.T.

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking, good fit and a great value
customer_reviews.text: Excellent fit and they seem well made, although not as nice as another vender's gloves that weren't available in my size. Good value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: ainadude

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: 1. Dont fit well. After many years I know I am 8 or 8.5 ( for chinese size gloves) 2. Leather? Maybe, but feels ... like man made material. 3. Weak. I`m worry they'll tear in any moment.
customer_reviews.author: Reader

customer_reviews.title: I like 'em
customer_reviews.text: They fit well. I like the feel of these leather gloves on my car's leather steering wheel & shifter.
customer_reviews.author: Lima Delta

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use a touchscreen while wearing
customer_reviews.text: Chinese made so they run a size small. Easy to use a touchscreen while wearing. Soft material. My last pair of drivers gloves died at 4 yr mark. We'll see how these do.
customer_reviews.author: J. C.

customer_reviews.title: Bought New sent Used
customer_reviews.text: Finally have time to write a review. I was excited for these new gloves and when i recieved them, the finger tips of my left gloves was torn up, as if someone put them on and used it for box cutting. If they were new, I would probably give it a 5. It fits perfectly and feels nice, doesnt get sweaty in 80 degree heat, and easy to take on and off. Just be wary before buying, I am pleased using it, just wish it didnt feel like someone else used it first.
customer_reviews.author: Mar

customer_reviews.title: Love their gloves
customer_reviews.text: Love their gloves. I own 3 pairs. The traditional, the shorties and the deer skin. Takes about a week or 2 to break in and soften up, but after that they’re like a second skin.
customer_reviews.author: Rick A

customer_reviews.title: 25, 000 Harley miles (two riding seasons), and ...
customer_reviews.text: 25,000 Harley miles (two riding seasons), and I am buying another pair that I expect to last the next two years. UPDATE: Now buying my 5th pair. Got 35,000 miles on last pair. These are not rain gloves. They will turn your hands black if they get a good soaking. Any pumis soap will wash it off.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Success, granny sure got it right this time!!
customer_reviews.text: I'm thinking great from reactions when he opened at birthday dinner, especially as also got a car that night. But he really did check them all out pretty closely and seemed excited.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: They fit perfectly and make steering easier. They arrived a couple days after I ordered them. Altogether, I am very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Spyder B

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for my husband and he loves them. He hasn’t had the dye issues that some purchasers have had.
customer_reviews.author: JENNIFER LENTZ REEVES

customer_reviews.title: Cold WX driving
customer_reviews.text: Measured size fit nice and snug. Fingers are slightly long but not an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Randall H.
